You are given a grid with 2 rows and $n$ columns. Each cell in the grid can be colored black or white.  

Two cells are considered neighbors if they share a side and have the same color. Two cells belong to the same component if they are neighbors, or if there is a neighbor of one cell that belongs to the same component as the other.

A coloring is considered "beautiful" if it has exactly $k$ components.

Count the number of beautiful colorings. The answer may be very large, so print it modulo 998244353.

You have a grid of squares. You need to color each square black or white.  The coloring is considered "beautiful" if it has exactly *k* groups of connected squares (where connected means sharing a side and having the same color).  How many different beautiful colorings are there?
